==Events==
*[[1364]] &ndash; Troops of the [[Republic of Pisa]] and the [[Republic of Florence]] clash in the [[Battle of Cascina]].
*[[1540]] &ndash; [[Thomas Cromwell]] is executed at the order of [[Henry VIII of England]] on charges of [[treason]]. Henry marries his fifth wife, [[Catherine Howard]], on the same day.
*[[1571]] &ndash; La Laguna [[encomienda]], known today as the [[Laguna (province)|Laguna]] province in the [[Philippines]] was founded by the Spaniards as one of the oldest encomienda/province in the country.
*[[1794]] &ndash; [[Maximilien Robespierre]] and [[Louis Antoine de Saint-Just]] are executed by [[guillotine]] in [[Paris|Paris, France]] during the [[French Revolution]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: [[Battle of Talavera]] &ndash; Sir [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington|Arthur Wellesley]]'s British, Portuguese and Spanish army defeats a French force led by [[Joseph Bonaparte]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[José de San Martín]] declares the independence of [[Peru]] from [[Spain]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[USS Constellation (1854)]], the last all-sail warship built by the [[United States Navy|US Navy]], is commissioned.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Ezra Church]] &ndash; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops make a third unsuccessful attempt to drive [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces from [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; At the age of 18, [[Vinnie Ream]] becomes the first and youngest female artist to receive a commission from the United States government for a statue (of [[Abraham Lincoln]]).
*[[1868]] &ndash; The [[Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|14th Amendment]] to the [[United States Constitution]] is certified, establishing [[African American]] citizenship and guaranteeing [[due process]] of law.
*[[1896]] &ndash; The city of [[Miami|Miami, Florida]] is incorporated.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Austria-Hungary]] declares war on [[Serbia]] after Serbia rejects the conditions of an ultimatum  sent by Austria on [[July 23]] following the [[Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria|assassination]] of [[Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria|Archduke Franz Ferdinand]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Herbert Hoover]] orders the [[United States Army]] to forcibly evict the "[[Bonus Army]]" of World War I veterans gathered in [[Washington, D.C.]]
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Diplomacy#Diplomatic relations|Diplomatic relations]] between the [[Soviet Union]] and Spain are established.
*[[1935]] &ndash; First flight of the [[Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; ''[[Hawaii Clipper]]'' disappears between [[Guam]] and [[Manila]] as the first loss of an airliner in trans-Pacific ''[[China Clipper]]'' service.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]] issues [[Order No. 227]] in response to alarming [[Nazi Germany|German]] advances into the Soviet Union. Under the order all those who retreat or otherwise leave their positions without orders to do so are to be immediately executed.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Bombing of Hamburg in World War II|Operation Gomorrah]] &ndash; The British bomb [[Hamburg|Hamburg, Germany]] causing a [[firestorm]] that kills 42,000 German civilians.
*[[1945]] &ndash; A U.S. Army [[North American B-25 Mitchell|B-25]] bomber [[B-25 Empire State Building crash|crashes]] into the 79th floor of the [[Empire State Building]] killing 14 and injuring 26.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Metropolitan Police Service|Metropolitan Police]] [[Flying Squad]] foils a [[Precious metal#Bullion|bullion]] robbery in the "Battle of London Airport".
*[[1955]] &ndash; The [[Union Mundial pro Interlingua]] is founded at the first [[Interlingua]] congress in [[Tours|Tours, France]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; Heavy rain and a mudslide in [[Isahaya, Nagasaki|Isahaya]], western [[Kyushu|Kyushu, Japan]], kill 992.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces his order to increase the number of United States troops in [[South Vietnam]] from 75,000 to 125,000.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Summer Jam at Watkins Glen]]: 600,000 people attend a [[rock festival]] at the [[Watkins Glen International]] Raceway.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Spetsgruppa A]], Russia's elite special force, was formed.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[1976 Tangshan earthquake|Tangshan earthquake]] measuring between 7.8 and 8.2 [[moment magnitude scale|moment magnitude]] flattens [[Tangshan]] in the People's Republic of China, killing 242,769 and injuring 164,851.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Andorra]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; The remains of a [[Prehistory|prehistoric]] man are discovered near [[Kennewick, Washington]]. Such remains will be known as the [[Kennewick Man]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; Australian [[Ian Thorpe]] becomes the first swimmer to win six gold medals at a single World Championships.
*[[2002]] &ndash; Nine [[Coal mining|coal mine]]rs trapped in the flooded [[Quecreek Mine Rescue|Quecreek Mine]] in [[Somerset County, Pennsylvania]], are rescued after 77 hours underground.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] calls an end to its thirty year long armed campaign in [[Northern Ireland]].
*  2005   &ndash; [[Tornado]]es touch down in residential areas in south [[Birmingham]] and [[Coventry|Coventry, England]], causing £4,000,000 worth of damages and injuring 39 people.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The historic [[Grand Pier, Weston-super-Mare|Grand Pier]] in [[Weston-super-Mare]] burns down for the second time in 80 years.
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Airblue Flight 202]] crashes into the [[Margalla Hills]] north of [[Islamabad|Islamabad, Pakistan]], killing all 152 people aboard. It is the deadliest aviation accident in Pakistan history and the first involving an [[Airbus A320 family|Airbus A321]].
